intro: Tibouchina almedae, commonly known as the Brazilian beauty or purple flame, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and a pleasant scent. Tibouchina almedae thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
